title: Aruba Wireless Engineer
description:
My name is Muralidharan and I’m working with Cloud Destinations LLC as a Technical Recruiter.

Below are the job details as needed by the hiring manager. Kindly advise if you might be interested and qualified for the below opportunity and if we can discuss further on this

**Position: L3 Aruba Wireless Engineer**

**Duration: 5-6 months Contract**

**Location: Remote, (with some travel)**

**Description:**

This role will be for an L3 Remote based, US resource. There will be required travel for surveys, etc. The role will be 30-40 hours weekly variable based on workload (expect more in the 35-40 hour range)  
**Overview**:

* The Senior Wireless Network Engineer must be a detail oriented, committed problem solver with robust communication skills who will execute the vision through the design and oversight of a web and mobile application platform.
* Responsible for setup and installation of technical systems, applications, or process designs for client’s purchased or outsourced technology and business process solutions. Works directly with client to manage initial access, map and transfer data, create process documentation, and train or coordinate training for client users.
* Tests and troubleshoots functionality of installed systems; identifies and documents technical issues to be escalated to product and system integration teams for resolution. Provides feedback based on client experiences to product and professional services teams for product and process improvements.
* Experience working for a Global multi-national corporation.
* MUST have Highly skilled with performing on-site Wireless survey s for AP placement. Must have strong experience with Aruba Wireless and Ekahau Sidekick 2 survey tools

**Required Experience:**

* Must have 8-10 years of experience in specification, design, development, and deployment of digital wireless networks and communication systems inclusive of :
* Wireless Pre-Design Site Visit, Wireless Predictive Design, Wireless Post Installation Survey, & APoS Surveys.
* Knowledge of 802.11 standards, CAPWAP, Cisco WLC; be able to use tools such as Cisco Prime Infrastructure, AirMagnet Spectrum, Ekahau Pro, or other Survey and RF tools, to design and support WLANS.
* Interact with clients on site to meet complex requirements of a solution.
* Escalate unresolved problems and issues to the relevant third parties.
* Respond to escalated client requests and support client applications to a first line resolution.
* Escalate complex problems to the relevant third parties.
* Write reports and proposals and complete and maintain project documentation.
* Assist with the documentation of standard operating procedures relating to installations and fixes.
* Expert understanding of Aruba Wireless Network architecture, design, configuration, and operations is required.
* Extensive practical knowledge of switching and routing protocols (OSPF, BGP, and EIGRP).
* Solid understanding of general Network and Security fundamentals.
* Remotely supporting clients within service level agreements (SLAs),
* Install and Configure software and hardware as well as resolve incidents,
* Perform root cause analysis and adhere to any related processes such as change management.
* Device and network performance analysis and troubleshooting skills
* Strong oral and written communication skills.
* Ability to lead technical discussions (internally and externally with vendors).
* Demonstrated technical success in a fast paced, results-oriented engineering environment.
* Ability to work independently, and mentor others.
* Possessing active certifications like: HPE Aruba Certifications, CCIE Wireless, Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) Wireless or Certified Wireless Network Professional (CWNP), is a strong plus.

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $70.00 - $75.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Aruba Wireless: 4 years (Required)
* Wireless Networking: 10 years (Required)
* Ekahau: 1 year (Required)

License/Certification:

* Certified Wireless Network Professional (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Cyber Threat Detection Lead
description:
Job Description:
Job Title
Cyber Threat Detection Lead
Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World
Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with other curious, creative 3Mers.
This position provides an opportunity to transition from other private, public, government or military experience to a 3M career.
The Impact You’ll Make in this Role
As a Cyber Threat Detection Lead, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. Here, you will make an impact by:  

* Develop strategic threat hunting plans and campaigns based on the latest threat intelligence and high-risk areas/assets.
* Lead threat hunts leveraging tools like SIEM, endpoint detection and response (EDR), threat intelligence platforms, and customized analytics.
* Identify gaps in detection coverage, policy enforcement, operational readiness, and other domains. Recommend improvements.
* Manage a team of cyber threat hunters. Drive continuous enhancement of team capabilities through training, mentoring, and knowledge sharing.
* Employ techniques like hypothesis testing, behavioral analytics, and adversary simulation to identify anomalies indicative of threat actor activity.
* Evaluate new security tools and controls for potential procurement through proofs of concept and pilot programs.
* Create metrics to measure and track threat hunting outcomes. Continuously improve hunting methodologies by incorporating learnings from past hunts.
* Collaborate with security operations, incident response, and intelligence teams to optimize detection capabilities across the organization.
* Synthesize and report on threat hunting findings, recommended mitigations, and security program improvements.
* Conduct deep-dive investigations into detected anomalies to determine root cause and scope of impact.
* Develop expertise in new attacker tools, techniques, and procedures to enhance monitoring coverage.


Your Skills and Expertise
To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications:* Bachelor’s degree or higher (completed and verified prior to start)
* Ten (10) years of threat hunting, security operations, or incident response experience in a private, public, government or military environment


Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:* Proficiency conducting structured hunts leveraging SIEM, EDR, threat intel, and customized analytics.
* Experience applying threat intelligence to guide hunting operations.
* Knowledge of common attacker TTPs across the cyber kill chain.
* Solid understanding of network protocols, system auditing, and OS internals.
* Strong ability to synthesize data and communicate technical details to leadership.
* Excellent mentoring, leadership, and project management skills.
* Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail.
* Familiarity with data analysis and visualization tools.


Work location:* Work Your Way Eligible (Employee choice to work remote, on site, or hybrid)


Travel: May include up to 5% domestic
Relocation Assistance: May be authorized
Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).
Supporting Your Well-being
3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.
Chat with Max
For assistance with searching through our current job openings or for more information about all things 3M, visit Max, our virtual recruiting
Applicable to US Applicants Only:The expected compensation range for this position is $201,308 - $246,043, which includes base pay plus variable incentive pay, if eligible. This range represents a good faith estimate for this position. The specific compensation offered to a candidate may vary based on factors including, but not limited to, the candidate’s relevant knowledge, training, skills, work location, and/or experience. In addition, this position may be eligible for a range of benefits (e.g., Medical, Dental & Vision, Health Savings Accounts, Health Care & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts, Disability Benefits, Life Insurance, Voluntary Benefits, Paid Absences and Retirement Benefits, etc.). Additional information is available at: https://www.3m.com/3M/en\\_US/careers-us/working-at-3m/benefits/.
Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Twitter @3M.
Responsibilities of this position include that corporate policies, procedures and security standards are complied with while performing assigned duties.
Our approach to flexibility is called Work Your Way, which puts employees first and drives well-being in ways that enable 3M’s business and performance goals. You have flexibility in where and when work gets done. It all depends on where and when you can do your best work.
Pay & Benefits Overview: https://www.3m.com/3M/en\\_US/careers-us/working-at-3m/benefits/
3M is an equal opportunity employer. 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.
Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.
3M Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement  

Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at 3M are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.

title: IAM Analyst
description:
**Skills:**

* **Identity Access & Governance (IAG):**


	+ Minimum of three years of hands-on experience in Identity Access & Governance, including policy enforcement, role management, and access certification.
* **Privileged Access Management (PAM):**


	+ Proven expertise in Privileged Access Management with hands-on experience in solutions like CyberArk or BeyondTrust.
	+ Ability to design and implement PAM policies and procedures.
* **Enterprise Directory Services:**


	+ Comprehensive understanding and at least three years of practical experience in managing Enterprise Directory Services.
	+ Proficiency in designing, implementing, and maintaining directory services solutions.
* **Detail-Oriented:**


	+ Exceptional attention to detail to ensure accuracy and security in identity and access management processes.
	+ Ability to analyze complex access scenarios and recommend appropriate solutions.
* **Communication Skills:**


	+ Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
	+ Ability to convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* **Hands-on Experience:**


	+ Hands-on experience with Saviynt or a comparable Identity Governance and Administration (IGA) platform.
	+ Proficiency in utilizing CyberArk or BeyondTrust for Privileged Access Management.
	+ Strong experience with Active Directory and Azure Entra.
* **Scripting/Development Background:**


	+ Preferred background in scripting and/or application development to automate identity and access management processes.
	+ Ability to create custom solutions and integrations to enhance IAM capabilities.
* **Regulatory Compliance:**


	+ Familiarity with regulatory requirements related to identity and access management.
	+ Ensure IAM practices align with industry standards and compliance mandates.
**Responsibilities:**

* **Identity Access & Governance (IAG):**


	+ Design, implement, and manage Identity Access & Governance policies and procedures.
	+ Conduct access certifications and enforce access controls based on organizational policies.
* **Privileged Access Management (PAM):**


	+ Implement and manage Privileged Access Management solutions, such as CyberArk or BeyondTrust.
	+ Define and enforce PAM policies to secure sensitive systems and data.
* **Enterprise Directory Services:**


	+ Manage and optimize Enterprise Directory Services, ensuring reliability and scalability.
	+ Implement best practices for directory services design and administration.
* **Security Automation:**


	+ Leverage scripting and application development skills to automate identity and access management processes.
	+ Enhance efficiency and accuracy through the development of custom solutions.
* **Incident Response:**


	+ Participate in incident response activities related to identity and access management.
	+ Investigate and remediate security incidents involving unauthorized access.
* **Documentation:**


	+ Maintain comprehensive documentation for identity and access management processes, policies, and configurations.
	+ Ensure documentation aligns with organizational and regulatory requirements.
* **Collaboration:**


	+ Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, security, and compliance, to align IAM practices with organizational goals.
	+ Provide expertise and support for identity-related initiatives.
* **Compliance and Auditing:**


	+ Ensure identity and access management practices adhere to regulatory requirements.
	+ Support internal and external audits related to IAM processes.

title: NG911 Security Engineer
description:
UNIVERSAL Technologies is seeking a NG911 Security Engineer for a remote position in Brooklyn, NY. **Candidates must reside in the EST time zone.** 

**Position:** The NG911 Security Engineer will ensure the National Emergency Number Association (NENA) and Association of Public Safety Communication Officials (APCO) standards are being met during the implementation of a complex NG911 system by implementing new security controls, ensuring security controls are adequate for all Public Safety Answering points (PSAPs) in the commission of the 911 program at PSAP.

**WHO WE ARE:**  
UNIVERSAL Technologies, LLC is a Women-Owned (M/WBE) IT solutions and consulting company focused at delivering enterprise systems that significantly improve our clients IT performance. We work across the IT spectrum including Development, Business/Systems/Data Analysis, Project Management, Cyber Security, Network Engineering, and High-Level System Architecture.

The pride in the services we provide and the accessibility and flexibility we provide to employees are what make Universal Technologies stand out from the rest! We hope to propel your IT career to the next level and excite our employees with new and challenging projects.

**WHAT WE OFFER:**  
Our W2 employees can expect the following benefits:

* Competitive pay
* Health/Dental Insurance
* Group Life Insurance
* 401K
* HSA/FSA
* Pre-Tax Transportation Program
* Generous Paid Time Off/Holiday Policy

**MANDATORY SKILLS/EXPERIENCE:**

* Minimum of 12 years’ experience in Information Technology.
* Minimum of 6 years’ network Security Engineering experience.
* Strong network security experience.
* Strong project management experience with experience leading NG911 projects.
* Any compliance experience, specifically HIPAA, is highly desirable.
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology or related field.
* Should be able to utilize security frameworks like NIST and MITRE.
* Strong knowledge of security management tools to facilitate troubleshooting, i.e. Wireshark, Net brain, Extra hop, Net witness, etc.
* Strong Identity and Access Management background.
* Experience with configuring DNS.
* Strong experience in performing security risk assessments.
* Understanding of VPN technologies.
* Knowledge of resilient designs to ensure high availability.
* Knowledge of IPS/IDS design as standalone hardware or as a feature within firewalls.
* Ability to create reports using KRI and KPI.
* Experience with Next Generation Firewalls including Palo alto, Fortinet, Forcepoint, etc.
* Understanding of SIP security design and implementation for Voice/Video and Data.
* Understanding for firewall policies and application security
* Experience in auditing/assessing data network security design.
* Experience in auditing/assessing applications security design**.**

**SCOPE OF SERVICES:**

* Participate in the implementation of security controls in a Public Safety ESINET and NENA compliant NG911 system.
* Ensure the National Emergency Number Association (NENA) and Association of Public Safety Communication Officials (APCO) standards are being met during the implementation of NG911.
* Ensure the security controls are adequate for all Public Safety Answering points (PSAPs) in the commission of the 911 program at PSAP.
* Develop security configuration of the ESINET Network Technology.
* Manage test cases and identify risks associated with system integrations.
* Provide security best practices in PSAPs.
* Review all vendor designs to ensure compliance with security standards and governance models established by the City of New York.
* Detect, manage, and investigate security monitoring tools.
* Provide expertise in integration and engineering of Security platforms.
* Collaborate with vendors to integrate security platforms into Public Safety infrastructure.
* Architect security controls.
* Assess Active Directory security roles and policies.
* Configure IDS/IPS security policies.
* Perform troubleshooting of Level 3 security related issues.
* Configure security policies in DNS.
* Examine current firewall policies and ensure completeness and accuracy.
* Lead resolution of security incidents.
* Collaborate with vendors, carriers, and other technical groups to implement new security controls and troubleshoot existing controls.

*UNIVERSAL Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer.*

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $130.00 - $140.00 per hour

Application Question(s):

* Do you reside in the EST time zone?
* Do you have a LinkedIn account?

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Information Technology: 10 years (Required)
* Security Engineering: 6 years (Required)
* leading NG911 projects: 6 years (Required)
* configuring DNS: 6 years (Required)
* SIP security design: 6 years (Required)
* auditing/assessing data network security design: 6 years (Required)
* uditing/assessing applications security design: 6 years (Required)
* NextGen Firewalls: 6 years (Required)
* security frameworks (NIST/MITRE): 6 years (Required)
* ESINET: 6 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Network Engineer
description:
At Diversified, we don't just follow tech trends - we set them by leveraging the best in technology and ongoing advisory services to transform businesses. Our comprehensive suite of solutions is engineered to help our clients build connections that make a difference – whether by inspiring viewers, engaging associates, motivating audiences, or streamlining and safeguarding operations.
  
Our dedicated teams craft solutions experienced by millions every day including:
  
* Delivering the fan experience at one of 100+ sports facilities for the NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, MLS, NCAA
* Building the first fly pack broadcast system transportable by air - bringing the 2022 World Cup and Super Bowl into homes across the world
* Engineering the first high-density pixel canvas to display HD content at that scale for the Vornado, Marriott Marquis LED Display in Times Square, NY
* Empowering and monitoring communication and collaboration solutions within multi-national companies around the globe


Founded in 1993, we’re a global organization serving local needs with associates worldwide. Learn more at onediversified.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.
  
  

What part will you play?
  
We are seeking a highly skilled Network Engineer with a strong background in network infrastructure design, implementation, and maintenance, along with proficiency in integrating audio-visual solutions into network environments. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of networking principles, protocols, and technologies, as well as hands-on experience in deploying and managing audio-visual systems within complex network architectures.
  
  

What will you be doing?
  
* Design, deploy, and maintain robust network infrastructure solutions, including routers, switches, firewalls, and other networking components, to ensure optimal performance, reliability, and security.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to assess, plan, and implement audio-visual solutions that meet the organization's needs, integrating AV equipment with existing network infrastructure.
* Configure and troubleshoot audio-visual devices, such as projectors, displays, video conferencing systems, and audio equipment, to ensure seamless operation and compatibility with the network.
* Develop and implement network policies, procedures, and best practices to optimize audio-visual performance, minimize latency, and ensure quality of service (QoS) for multimedia traffic.
* Conduct network capacity planning and performance monitoring to identify potential bottlenecks, optimize resource utilization, and proactively address network issues.
* Collaborate with vendors and third-party service providers to evaluate new audio-visual technologies, products, and services, and make recommendations for their adoption based on business requirements and technical feasibility.
* Provide technical leadership and mentorship to junior network engineers, sharing knowledge and best practices related to audio-visual integration and network management.
* Stay up-to-date with emerging networking and audio-visual technologies, standards, and trends, and assess their potential impact on the organization's infrastructure and operations.
* Participate in project planning and execution, including requirements gathering, solution design, implementation, testing, and documentation, ensuring alignment with business objectives and timelines.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define and prioritize requirements for audio-visual solutions, ensuring alignment with business goals and user needs.


What do we require from you?
  
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field; or equivalent work experience.
* Minimum of 3 years of experience in network engineering, with a focus on designing, deploying, and managing enterprise-level networks.
* Strong understanding of networking principles and protocols, including TCP/IP, VLANs, OSPF, BGP, MPLS, QoS, and multicast.
* Hands-on experience with network equipment from vendors such as Cisco, Juniper, Aruba, and Palo Alto Networks, including routers, switches, firewalls, and VPNs.
* Proficiency in integrating audio-visual solutions into network environments, with experience configuring and troubleshooting AV devices and protocols (e.g., HDMI, HDCP, HDBaseT, Dante).
* Familiarity with audio-visual standards and technologies, such as H.264, H.265, SIP, WebRTC, Dante, AES67, and SDVoE.
* Experience with video conferencing systems (e.g., Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Cisco Webex) and collaboration tools, including setup, configuration, and troubleshooting.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify, diagnose, and resolve complex network and AV issues in a timely manner.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and vendors.
* Industry certifications such as CCNP, CCIE, CompTIA Network+, AVIXA CTS, or equivalent are a plus.


**Preferred Qualifications of the Network Engineer:**  

* It will be good to have an understanding of the following technologies:
* AMP
* SSL
* TACAS+
* MPLS
* WAAS
* DMVPN
* Palo Alto
* F5 Load Balancer
* Practical use of scripting languages
* SDN
* AAA
* NAT
* VPN
* EIGRP
* OSPF


**Note:** This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the position and is not an exhaustive list of skills, efforts, duties, responsibilities, or working conditions associated with it. Management reserves the right to modify duties or assign additional duties as needed.
  
  

To learn more about becoming part of the Diversified team, visit us at http://diversifiedus.com/about/careers/ or email us at careers@onediversified.com.
  
  

Diversified is an equal employment opportunity employer and all aspects of employment will be based on job requirements, individual qualifications, merit, performance and business needs. We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, age, disability or genetic information, or any other applicable characteristic protected under federal, state or local law. We celebrate diversity and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply for available positions. Individuals needing assistance or an accommodation to complete an application due to a disability, may contact Human Resources at careers@onediversified.com.

title: Senior Network Engineer
description:
We are seeking an experienced Senior Network Engineer (SNE) to manage and maintain the company’s enterprise network. As a SNE, you will be responsible for the functional management of our network, the delegation of tasks, and the resolution of network issues.

To ensure success as a SNE, you should have extensive experience working with enterprise networks, high-level managerial skills, and advanced project management skills. As a top-class SNE you will ensure that the networking team performs as a cohesive unit, maintaining the stability and performance of the network.

**Responsibilities:**

· Managing client server installations, logistics, and upgrades of server, storage, and network infrastructure within budget, time, and scope.

· Installing and configuring networking hardware.

· Creating and implementing network security measure.

· Conducting regular network performance tests.

· Dealing with escalated network support issues.

· Drawing-up network status report.

**Requirements:**

· Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, or related field.

· Previous work experience as a network engineer.

· Working knowledge in the majority of the following areas: design, environments, LAN/WAN networking, network security, storage, backup systems, server operating systems, MS SQL, MS Exchange, virtualization, Cloud, and compliance.

· Knowledge of networking hardware including CPUs, wiring, and routers.

· Familiarity with communication and routing protocols.

· Excellent LAN/WAN/WLAN knowledge.

· Provide technical design recommendations and associated architectures by gathering and documenting existing client network and device information.

· Ability to establish and maintain a professional working relationship at multiple levels both internally and with clients.

· High level problem-solving and communications skill

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $98,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* LAN: 1 year (Preferred)

Security clearance:

* Confidential (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Network Engineer L2
company: NTT Global Data Centers Americas, Inc.
description:
NTT is a leading global IT solutions and services organisation that brings together people, data and things to create a better and more sustainable future.


In today’s ‘iNTTerconnected’ world, connections matter more now than ever. By bringing together talented people, world-class technology partners and emerging innovators, we help our clients solve some of the world’s most significant technological, business and societal challenges.


With people at the heart of our success, NTT is committed to attracting and growing the best talent and providing an environment where everyone feels they can belong and their contribution matters.

 **Want to be a part of our team?**


This is a mid-level position that interfaces with multiple stakeholders in the company in order to understand requirements, business constraints, problem domain, viable technology, and development. This role determines multiple design alternatives, assesses such alternatives based on given or self-defined criteria, and selects the most suited option to refine to a final design. Regular, predictable attendance is essential for satisfactory performance.**Working at NTT**

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Analyzes the current infrastructure and continually look for improvements in availability and optimization.
* Ensures IT architectures, practices, policies, and plans align with company's business goals.
* Works with other engineers to provide a consensus-based solution that is scalable, adaptable and in synchronization with ever changing business needs.
* Manages risks associated with information and IT assets by developing and documenting appropriate standards, practices, and security policies.
* Accomplishing organizational goals by accepting ownership for new requests; explore opportunities to add value to Business.
* Handling Technical & process escalations to ensure services are met within agreed SLA.
* Escalation Engagement with L3 & L4 for escalated /complex troubleshooting and pending issue.
* Promotes the practice to find area in our infrastructure to reduce costs and improve efficiencies.
* Supports automation of network infrastructure operational activities to reduce toil (e.g., device certification, onboarding, provisioning, migrations, patching, refreshes, upgrades, decommissions, observability, triaging)
* Selects new technologies while observing the various constraints such as cost, time frame and security.
* Draws up development and integration plans.
* Builds test environments, and pilots deployment.

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES**

* Customer service orientation.
* Stress management and ability to handle a fast paced, rapidly changing environment.
* Process tickets which may include escalations, alarms, incidents and service requests reported by monitoring tools, ticketing portals, calls and emails.
* Ability to manage a network ticketing queue and identify, report and remediate trends.
* Problem solving, with the ability to mentor and work with other team members to resolve issues then focus on establishing long term solutions rather than quick fixes.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken.
* Excellent documentation skills.
* Ability to explain complex technical issues in a way that non-technical people may understand.
* Knowledge of IT change processes.
* Creating KB articles for well known issues.
* Basic project and program management planning and organizational skills, as well as time management and prioritization capabilities.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality and show discretion.
* Vendor Engagement / Escalations over Emails, Vendor Portals and Phone as & when required for as part of the reported Network issue.
* Understanding of Internet Protocols (DNS, SMTP, SNMP, SSH, Telnet).
* Understanding with Multi-homed ISP (BGP,ISIS).
* Understanding with Routing & Switching (OSPF, STP, HSRP).
* Understanding with Firewalls and access lists.
* Understanding of Load Balancing.
* Understanding of Access Point and Virtual Controllers.
* Research and keep abreast of current and new technologies and be aware of its implications to customers and Global Data Centers of America.


#GlobalDataCentersCareers

**EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE**

* 5-7 years of experience in Information Technology, with 3-6 years in the subject area.
* Current or demonstrated progress towards attainment of Juniper and/or Cisco CCNP or JNCIE (or equivalent).
* High School Diploma or GED required
* Bachelors Degree Preferred

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**

* Primarily sitting with some walking, standing, and bending.
* Able to hear and speak into a telephone.
* Close visual work on a computer terminal.
* Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate any required computer keyboard, mouse, and other technical instruments.
* Ability to lift and carry, up to 20 lbs
* Able to climb a ladder and work on a raised platform.

**WORK CONDITIONS & OTHER REQUIREMENTS**

* Remote work with extensive daily usage of a computer.
* Must live within a state that has a GDCA Data Center.
* Responsible to carry a cell phone and provide 24 x 7 escalated support as needed.
* Must be willing to work outside normal business hours, including weekends, late nights, holidays and on-call support.
* Must be comfortable working in a highly critical, fast paced environment with shifting priorities.
* Occasional travel may be required.
* Must possess a current, valid state-issued driver’s license.
* Must be able to respond to emergency situations at the data center.


This is a remote position that requires reliable internet connection and electricity. A monthly stipend is provided to cover expenses associated with working remotely and use of a personal mobile device, if applicable.


NTT Global Data Centers Americas, Inc. offers competitive compensation based on experience, education, and location. Base salary for this position is $ 85,000 - $ 126,000.

  

All regular full-time employees are eligible for an annual bonus; payout is dependent upon individual and company performance.

  

Employees receive paid time-off, medical, dental, and vision benefits, life and supplemental insurance, short-term and long-term disability, flexible spending account, and 401k retirement plan to create a rich Total Rewards package.

**Skills Summary**


Networking Solutions, Network Maintenance, Network Monitoring, Network Security, Network Troubleshooting**What will make you a good fit for the role?**

**Workplace type****:**

Remote Working**Equal Opportunity Employer**


NTT is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category

 **Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.**

 **A career at NTT means:**

* Being part of a **global pioneer –** where you gain exposure to our Fortune 500 clients and world-leading global technology partners and work with a network of over 40,000 smart and diverse colleagues across 57 countries, delivering services in over 200 countries.
* Being at the forefront of **cutting-edge technology –** backed with a 150-year heritage of using technology for good. With 40% of the world’s internet traffic running on our network and where Emoji were first invented, you can be proud of the group’s many new ‘firsts’.
* **Making a difference –** by doing meaningful work that helps to shape the future for our clients, and across industries and communities around the world.
* Being **your best self –** in a progressive ‘Connected Working’ environment that promotes flexibility, connection and wellbeing. Where diversity and different perspectives are embraced to ensure equal opportunities for all.
* Having ongoing opportunities to **own and develop your career –** with a personal and professional development plan and access to the broadest learning offerings in the industry.

title: Network Architect
description:
About Us

We are a team of Architects, Senior Data, Application, and System Engineers, recognized for our elite capabilities in guiding clients worldwide through their digital transformation, data modernization, and cloud migration journeys. Our focus, predominantly in the data space, extends into a comprehensive array of services, including network infrastructure projects which are pivotal for our client's success in today's digital economy.

The Role

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated CCIE Network Infrastructure Engineer to join our team on a contract basis. This is a unique opportunity to work with an elite group of professionals on cutting-edge projects. The role is fully remote, offering the flexibility to work from anywhere, designed for an individual ready to make an immediate impact.

Duration & Availability

* **Contract Length:** 6-12 months, full-time engagement
* **Start Date:** Within 2-3 weeks from the job posting, with a preference for near-immediate availability

Key Responsibilities

* Design, implement, and manage complex network infrastructure projects with a strong focus on Cisco Nexus series (9500, 9600, 9300) and Cisco ITD.
* Develop and maintain high-security network environments, incorporating Palo Alto firewalls and advanced load balancing techniques.
* Work closely with clients to architect and deploy network infrastructure that supports digital transformation, data warehouse modernization, and cloud migration initiatives.
* Lead projects with minimal oversight, demonstrating a strong ability to manage time, resources, and project deliverables.
* Collaborate with a team of elite Architects, Engineers, and Analysts to deliver high-quality, scalable solutions.

Requirements

* **Certification:** Current CCIE certification is mandatory.
* **Experience:** Proven experience with Cisco Nexus 9500, 9600, 9300 series, and Cisco ITD. Strong background in managing Palo Alto firewalls and load balancing within complex environments.
* **Skills:** Exceptional technical, analytical, and problem-solving skills. Ability to work effectively in a fully remote setting. Strong communication and leadership qualities, capable of guiding teams and leading projects to success.
* **Contract Type:** Open to 1099 or Corporate-to-Corporate arrangements.

Ideal Candidate

The ideal candidate is a forward-thinking leader, eager to take charge and drive projects forward. You are highly experienced, with a knack for staying ahead in your field, constantly seeking opportunities for growth and development. Your expertise enables you to navigate complex environments with ease, making you a valuable asset to any project.

Why Join Us?

Joining our team means being part of an organization that values innovation and leadership. We offer a dynamic work environment where your contributions will directly impact our success and the success of our clients. This role is an excellent opportunity to expand your skills, work on challenging projects, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: From $80.00 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 40 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Referral program

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: Remote

title: Network Engineer - End to End
description:
About us:

One team. Global challenges. Infinite opportunities. At Viasat, we’re on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. For more than 35 years, Viasat has helped shape how consumers, businesses, governments and militaries around the globe communicate. We’re looking for people who think big, act fearlessly, and create an inclusive environment that drives positive impact to join our team.
What you'll do:

As an End to End Network Engineer, you will use customer feedback to recommend design or re-design, develop, test, and implement changes to Viasat Mobile Terminals and Viasat SATCOM Network customers operate on. You will also provide technical, network, and software support/expertise to customers, testing applications, responding to customer feedback, installations, maintenance and assist Business Units in development of sales presentations by providing technical expertise and customer feedback. Additionally, you will work multi-functionally with the other engineering teams, sales teams, customer service teams, and the manufacturing teams.


The day-to-day:

You will be charged with assisting in the design, development, and implementation of applications and Viasat products, develop plans, designs and standard methodology implementation for the ground infrastructure network solutions using multiple platforms and protocols. You will support and fix network issues, and coordinate with vendors for installation of items such as routers and switches while working on project implementation, perform a variety of project management functions including handling vendors, scheduling, billing discrepancies, license management, audits, cost analysis, and vendor comparisons. Additionally, you'll analyze customer issues and recommend changes that respond to customer needs and provide innovative solutions to common problems and perform software/hardware piloting, application tests, and document reviews to ensure product is satisfactory.

  

From service start-up through the warranty period and post warranty, the Network Engineers provide customers with ongoing technical support including addressing issues, assisting with installs, and working with the various cross-function teams. The engineer will also perform duties which accurately detail customer issues and may require development changes.


What you'll need:
* 5+ years' hands-on experience in Satellite Communications industry, specifically working with SATCOM, RF, networking, and wireless communications
* Proven SATCOM Network experience with configuration, installation, maintaining and/or integration background
* Experience in networking, internet, and UNIX systems administration
* SATCOM/RF theory experience and how it pertains to mobile platforms
* Bachelor’s degree in relevant technical field or equivalent experience.
* US Government position. US Citizenship required
* Active Secret Clearance or active within the last two years
* Active Security+ certification or ability to gain within 6-months of employment
* Must be willing and able to work a rotating on-call schedule
* Ability to travel up to 20%


What will help you on the job:
* 5+ years' experience of installation and staging of RF/SATCOM networking equipment
* Firm grasp of Viasat's Ka networks and mobile terminals (E2E)
* Working knowledge of the OSI model.
* Shows ease of use with Linux/Unix Commands
* Experience with Active Directory, Domain Services, Windows Server, and RHEL Enterprise
* Experience with Military SATCOM systems or Commercial Aircraft SATCOM systems
* Experience with Virtualization technology (VMWare, KVM, VDI, HyperV)
* Proficiency with network monitoring protocols and tools such as SNMP, Wireshark, Cacti, Kentik, and Tivoli
* Active PCEP/PCAP certification (Python)
* Experience with Splunk queries and dashboards
* MySQL/SQL experience
* Cisco, Palo Alto, and/or Fortinet experience
* Validated ability implementing AAA devices (E.g., ISE, TACACS, Radius, etc.).


Salary range: $104,900.00 - $182,400.00 / annually : At Viasat, we consider many factors when it comes to compensation, including the scope of the position as well as your background and experience. Base pay may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Additional cash or stock incentives may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. Learn more about Viasat’s comprehensive benefit offerings that are focused on your holistic health and wellness at careers.viasat.com/LifeAtViasat/Benefits. EEO statement:

Viasat is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, genetics, age, or veteran status or any other applicable legally protected status or characteristic. If you would like to request an accommodation on the basis of disability for completing this on-line application, please click here.

title: Payments Network Analyst
description:
We are a hybrid, remote-office company dedicated to growing our talent anywhere!



We have onsite locations in: Sioux Falls, SD, Scottsdale, AZ, Troy, MI, Franklin, TN, Dallas, TX



At Pathward, we take tremendous pride in our purpose to create financial inclusion for all™. We are a financial empowerment company that works with innovators to increase financial availability, choice, and opportunity for all. We strive to remove barriers that traditional institutions put in the way of financial access, and promote economic mobility by providing responsible, secure, high quality financial products.



We are a team of problem solvers and innovators who celebrate our differences and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger and well-positioned for success. We celebrate, and embrace, our team members through our **\\*HUMBLE\\*HUNGRY\\*SMART** approach, and we believe that we are strongest when we embrace the voices of our employees, customers, partners, and the communities we serve.

**About the Role:**



The Payment Network Analyst's main function is work closely with Meta teams for the successful implementation and support of payment network changes and relationships.


**What You Will Do:**


* Oversee network bulletin process and communicate changes to appropriate parties.
* Research and assess business impacts to both the issuing and acquiring business lines.
* Identify required action items, lead changes related to network compliance and issue resolution in a collaborative manner.
* Document, plan and schedule necessary tasks ensuring work items are completed within the network timeframes.
* Track and report assessed fines/penalties associated to network compliance.
* Respond to customer needs within established SLA timeframes
* Educate internal teams and external partners on network rules, banking regulations and operating procedures as needed.
* Act as liaison with payment networks for changes to network mandates and operational functions
* Contribute in virtual meetings and keep team members informed of relevant tasks and issues including current status, dependencies and expected timelines for completion.
* Verify forms completed by Payment Network Specialists and provide sign off for Network submission.
* Complete, submit, and retain all necessary documentation and reports to Associations/Networks to support card programs.
* Complete, submit, and retain all necessary documentation to support implementation, modification and deletion of BINs for Meta issued card programs.
* Review network forms from partners and processors for completeness and accuracy.
* Obtain, track and verify necessary approvals for BIN actions.
* Track assigned tasks and outstanding issues and maintain updates in Bank systems
* Document, track and facilitate resolution of network related issues in support of internal teams and clients.
* Document progress and completion of tasks in Action Logs.
* Mentor staff by answering questions and providing technical advice.
* Facilitate training and education of new network mandates.
* Support and assist team with ICA/BIN management tasks and issues.
* Perform other duties as assigned.


**What You Will Need:**


* Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent experience required.
* 1+ year's Payment Network and relationship management experience.


*The responsibilities listed above are not all inclusive and may be changed at any time.*

Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary for your location during the hiring process. Ranges may be modified in the future.  

This role is also eligible for an annual performance-based incentive opportunity. Pathward offers a comprehensive benefits package for eligible employees, including health insurance, 401(k) retirement benefits, life insurance, disability benefits, paid time off, and more.

You may be just the right candidate for this or other Pathward roles.***

title: Network Engineer/Technician
description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced **Contract Network Technician/Engineer. Y**ou will be responsible for providing a variety of network support services to our clients on a project basis. You will work independently and collaboratively with our internal team and client personnel to ensure successful project completion.

**Responsibilities:**

* Design, install, and configure network infrastructure, including switches, routers, firewalls, and wireless access points.
* Troubleshoot and resolve network connectivity issues, identify bottlenecks, and implement solutions for improved network performance.
* Maintain accurate documentation of network configurations and changes.
* Assist with network upgrades and migrations.
* Collaborate with clients to understand their needs and recommend appropriate network solutions.

description:

Not Applicable/None

title: Incident Response Engineer
description:
Rockwell Automation is a global technology leader focused on helping the world’s manufacturers be more productive, sustainable, and agile. With more than 28,000 employees who make the world better every day, we know we have something special. Behind our customers - amazing companies that help feed the world, provide life-saving medicine on a global scale, and focus on clean water and green mobility - our people are energized problem solvers that take pride in how the work we do changes the world for the better.
We welcome all makers, forward thinkers, and problem solvers who are looking for a place to do their best work. And if that’s you we would love to have you join us!
Job Description
At Rockwell Automation, we bring together the imaginations of people with the potential of technology to expand what is humanly possible, making the world more intelligent, more connected and more productive. Our mission is to improve the quality of life by making the world more productive and sustainable.
Our technologies are used globally to deliver important services, such as power and water, and to enable critical manufacturing. Reporting to the Global Incident Management Leader, you will work with a high-performing team of like-minded individuals passionate about ensuring that our products are delivered with the highest levels of security and safety. You will work with an array of technologies in software, IoT, cloud, and embedded systems. Join us in the Enterprise Cybersecurity Team as we deliver safe, and secure technologies to protect our global community and the important services and goods they provide.
Job Responsibilities Include:* Monitor dashboards and intrusion detection and prevention systems (IDS/IPS)
* Perform initial analysis and investigation into alerts as they are seen (to include anti-virus and phishing alerts
* Perform initial malware analysis utilizing automated means
* Support cyber defense functions to protect our clients from cyber security incidents that have potential to cause negative impact
* Incident intake, ticket updates and reporting of cyber events
* Use SOC monitoring devices (SIEM, IDS, DLP) to review pre-defined events indicative of incidents
* Understand, identify and research IOCs
* Upload packets and evaluate source/destination activity and payloads
* Assist in recommendations for content to detect incidents, including IOCs for blocking and detection
* Participate in security incident response exercises and drills to ensure preparedness for real-world incidents.
* Stay informed about the latest cybersecurity threats, vulnerabilities, and trends.
* Collaborate with teams to enhance our overall security posture.
* Provide communication to team members regarding security incidents and remediation efforts.
* You will be asked to work a shift schedule and support coverage efforts on a 24x7x365 basis which includes work on holidays, nights, & weekends.


Basic Qualifications:* Bachelor's Degree OR equivalent experience
* Legal authorization to work in the US is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job opening.


Preferred Qualifications:* Typically requires a minimum of 2 years in incident response
* Security+ Certification and 6+ months of Cyber or Help Desk IT Work Experience in a professional environment
* Experience monitoring Antivirus, Intrusion Detection Systems, Firewalls, Active Directory, Web Proxies, Vulnerability Assessment tools and other security tools found in large enterprise network environments
* Experience working with Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) solutions
* Familiarity with multiple network and host based security applications and tools, such as network and host assessment/scanning tools, network and host based intrusion detection systems, and other security software packages. Host based forensics and malware analysis experience.
* Experience on a Computer Incident Response Team (CIRT), Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT), Computer Security Incident Response Center (CSIRC) or a Security Operations Center (SOC).
* Microsoft Sentinel
* SourceFire/FirePower/Snort
* Crowdstrike Falcon


What We Offer:* Health Insurance including Medical, Dental and Vision
* 401k
* Paid Time off
* Parental and Caregiver Leave
* Flexible Work Schedule where you will work with your manager to enjoy a work schedule that can be flexible with your personal life.
* To learn more about our benefits package, please visit at www.raquickfind.com.

*We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.**At Rockwell Automation we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right person for this or other roles.*
This position is part of a job family. Experience will be the determining factor.
#LI-MG1
#LI-REMOTE
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer including disability and veterans.
If you are an individual with a disability and you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation during the application process, please contact our services team at +1 (844) 404-7247.

title: Network Cloud Engineer
description:
**Job Title:** Network Engineer


**Location:** Fully Remote


**Salary:** DOE + full benefits


**Clearance:** Public Trust

  


**Company Overview**



TechSur Solutions is a digital services company whose mission is to enable digital transformation for our customers improving quality and efficiency. Based in the DC metropolitan area, TechSur specializes in advanced cloud services, modernization for both IT structures and applications, leveraging Agile development, and Data Analytics. Since we were formed in August of 2016, we have supported multiple impactful and exciting government programs.

  


**Job Overview**



As a Network Engineer, you will be a critical member of our team responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining robust network infrastructures that support the mission-critical operations of federal government agencies. Your role will involve ensuring the security, performance, and reliability of network systems in compliance with federal regulations and standards.

  


**Job Responsibilities**



Network Design and Implementation:


* Collaborate with federal clients to understand their networking requirements and design scalable and secure network architectures.
* Implement and configure network solutions, ensuring seamless integration with existing infrastructure.


Security and Compliance:


* Implement and maintain network security measures in accordance with federal regulations.
* Conduct regular security assessments and audits, addressing vulnerabilities and ensuring ongoing compliance, including adherence to FISMA standards.


Performance Monitoring and Optimization:


* Establish and maintain monitoring systems to track network performance metrics.
* Identify and implement optimizations to enhance network efficiency and reliability.


Collaboration and Documentation:


* Work closely with cross-functional teams, providing expertise in network design and troubleshooting.
* Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for network configurations and protocols.


Incident Response and Troubleshooting:


* Act as a point of contact for network-related incidents, conducting thorough troubleshooting and providing timely resolutions.
* Collaborate with cybersecurity teams to address and mitigate security incidents.

  


**Required Skills/Qualifications**


* Proven experience as a Network Engineer, with a focus on federal government projects.
* In-depth knowledge of networking protocols, technologies, and security standards.
* Familiarity with federal cybersecurity standards, including FISMA.
* Experience with network hardware, software, and monitoring tools.
* Strong understanding of routing, switching, VPNs, and firewall technologies.
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.

 **Education**


* Bachelor’s degree in network engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.

title: Engineer III-Network Operation
description:
**About this Role:**

  



The NOC Support team is responsible for identifying and implementing improvements in process and automation for Windstream’s Core NOC. Team members help to facilitate changes for Windstream’s Access, Ip, Transport, Power & Environments, and Voice technologies which are deployed in a national ISP network. The successful candidate will be responsible for collaborating with NOC Teams to create meaningful and efficient automations which will define alarming thresholds, reduce ticket volume, and enrich tickets with data that improves the effectiveness of analysts. When these automations do not perform as expected, the engineer will document the issue as they progress to a resolution. It will also be that the candidate will provide guidance to newer team members in their development efforts as well. Finally this team member will be responsible for training team members on existing automations for the purpose of troubleshooting and restoration in the event of catastrophic failures.


Team members typically work during normal business hours but may be required to work with other shifts to better understand challenges they face, implement/validate new implementations, or resolve critical bugs.


**What You’ll Do:**


* Perform complex Software Engineering tasks (dependent on project needs) such as requirements review, design, documentation, development, testing and preparing for release.
* Involvement in life cycle of various projects. May design, author and/or review design documentation for projects. Analyzes solutions created by other engineers and provide feedback.
* Review requirement documents for feasibility of project as a whole. Participate in team design/code reviews.
* Based on project needs, interface with other groups and review impact to other applications and teams.
* Participate in team meetings to review status of projects. Troubleshoot and correct production issues.
* Collaborate and/or mentor other engineers and provide technical guidance relative to their projects as needed.
* Research new technologies to improve business processes and automations.
* Review software build and installation instructions.
* Other duties as assigned.



**Required:**


* Java/J2EE, PYTHON or PHP


* Oracle SQL, MariaDB, and PL/SQL (9i, 10g, 11g)
* Linux/UNIX scripting
* GWT or other JavaScript technologies
* SOAP or REST web services
* Application Integration/Enterprise Service Bus


* Zabbix


* Netcool


* OpenNMS



**Preferred:**


* Telecom billing / provisioning (RevChain / MetaSolv)


* Experience with ISP Network environment


* Project management


* Data analysis

**Our Benefits:**


* Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance Plans
* 401K Plan
* Health & Flexible Savings Account
* Life and AD&D, Spousal Life, Child Life Insurance Plans
* Educational Assistance Plan
* Identity Theft, Legal, Auto & Home and Pet Insurance
* https://windstreambenefits.com

  


**Windstream CIB Statement**



Connecting people in a world of infinite possibilities. Windstream cultivates a workplace culture where innovation and belonging are the cornerstones of our success. We are dedicated to empowering every member of our team to contribute their unique talents and perspectives, fostering an environment where creativity and innovation flourish. Together, we strive to build a more welcoming and connected future, both within our organization and in the broader community we serve.

  


**Our Employee Resource Groups:**


* WinVets – Veteran Employee Resource Group


* WOW – Women Employee Resource Group


* WINPRIDE – LGBTQ+ Employee Resource Group


* WBPN – Black Professional Resource Group


* WARG – Ability Resource Group


* LaFamilia –Hispanic Resource Group



**About Us:**



Windstream Holdings is a privately held communications and software company. Windstream offers managed communications services, including SD-WAN and UCaaS, and high-capacity bandwidth and transport services to businesses across the U.S. The company also provides premium broadband, entertainment, and security services through an enhanced fiber network to consumers and small and midsize businesses primarily in rural areas in 18 states.



The starting compensation range for this job is $77,800 to $102,200


Actual base pay for this job will depend on the candidate's primary work location and other factors, such as relevant skills and experience.
  
**Job Requirements**
--------------------


**Qualifications**  

Education and Experience: College degree in Engineering or a related field and 3-5 years professional level experience; or 7 years professional level related Engineering/Technical experience; or an equivalent combination of education and professional level related Engineering/Technical experience required.

 **EEO Statement:** Windstream is an equal opportunity employer. At Windstream, we celebrate the authenticity and uniqueness of our people and their ideas. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, genetic information, protected veteran status, current military status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, creed, citizenship status, or any other status protected by law, and to give full consideration to qualified disabled individuals and protected veterans. The diverse voices of our employees fuel our innovation and our inclusive culture. Employment at Windstream is subject to post offer, pre-employment drug testing.

title: Associate Information Security Engineer
description:
Summary of Position


The Security Operations Canter (SOC) provides DDoS detection and mitigation services for Vercara and Customer’s Networks. The SOC also provides all Customer Support capabilities for the UltraDDoS Protect service. UltraDDoS Protect is a strategic service for the Digital Defense and Performance BU. We are seeking an Associate Information Security Engineer to support our ever-growing customer base.

  

Duties/Responsibilities

  

* Assist with complex attacks to refine mitigation strategies.
* Provision customers on the SP platform.
* Interact with Arbor SOC personnel as necessary.
* Monitor/mitigate DDoS events against Vercara Properties.
* Monitor the ticket queue.
* Answer the phone queue for Tier 1 support in DDOS and WAF customers.
* Help customers resolve technical issues within the UltraDDoS Protect service (to include WAF).
* Mitigate customer DDoS attacks.

  

Specific skills required

* Proficient interpersonal communication skills
* Flexibility in schedule, we are a 24/7 operation.

  

Knowledge & Application - Learns to use professional concepts. Applies knowledge and basic problem-solving techniques to define and resolve problems. Determines a course of action based on guidelines.

  

Complexity & Problem Solving - Works on problems of limited scope. Follows standard practices and procedures in analyzing situations or data from which answers can be readily obtained. Work is reviewed periodically based on a set of defined procedures or precedence. Normally receives general instruction on work and new assignments.

  

Collaboration & Interaction - Develops stable working relationships internally. Exchanges standard/basic information with colleagues and immediate supervisor, project leaders and other professionals in the team/group.

  

Typical Degree & Years of Experience - Requires a bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 1+ years of related experience, or equivalent work experience.

  

Salary range: $60,000 - $65,000

title: Network Planning Engineer
description:
Remote - Successful candidate must live in a state in which Point Broadband operates (AL, FL, GA, MD, MI, OH, TN, TX, or VA)
  
  

**Summary:**  

Point Broadband is looking for an experienced telecommunications professional with proven expertise in network planning and optimization, project management, vendor management, and delivering efficiencies in cost management. The successful candidate will have experience in spend elimination/reduction through internal/external disputes, disco by discovery, vendor/customer renewals and large-scale renewal agreement planning, and NNI Optimization and consolidation.
  
  

**Essential Job Functions:**  

* Responsible for managing all aspects of route design, network capacity management, and long-range network planning for Metro and Long-Haul networks
* Direct interface to external communications vendors for circuit ordering, provisioning and installation coordination
* Manage databases of contract terms, billing, and customer/vendor interfaces
* Collaborate with other planning disciplines in preparing and prioritizing project plans to address opportunity requirements in the most cost effective and commercially successful manner
* Prioritize Project Feasibility Analysis - Evaluating multiple project concepts and opportunities and managing multiple projects in various stages of completion
* Analyzes and identifies optimization opportunities to groom, replace or renew circuits for the existing customer base
* Review customer renewal proposals as provided by Sales and action to achieve or exceed expected target savings
* Ensure monthly and annual network cost savings are archived in order to meet department and corporate financial objectives
* Management of circuit grooms resulting from cost savings initiatives, site decommissioning and network consolidations
* Maintains accurate network elements and circuit entrance facility management inventories in provisioning databases and/or excel spreadsheets so that technical and provisioning personnel can utilize and rely on to complete their own duties
* Develops and distributes weekly report on capacity utilization monitoring for entrance facilities. Identifies and recommends where and when augments or reductions are required
* Assist in researching billing disputes and provide documentation for network cost department as required. Update monthly price increases as received per vendor notifications. Adjust monthly pricing as it relates to expired vendor ramp terms or specific commitment levels
* Assess the probability of revenue and/or cost leakage based on defined tolerance levels, and takes appropriate actions
* Understands and implements traffic analysis and studies for long term planning
* Works closely with production engineering for MACD planning on the production network, collocation sites and datacenters
* Possesses the skill set to produce monthly reporting on cost, utilization, term renewals, etc.


**Education and Experience:**  

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
  
  

10+ years of relevant telecommunications experience including expense management / network planning / vendor management / capacity managament roles
  
  

* Strong understanding of complex provisioning functions and Project Management
* Experience in order coordination in a high paced, process-oriented organization
* Strong time management and complex task organization skills
* Working knowledge of Ethernet, MPLS, SDH, SONET, TDM, VPLS, QOS, VoIP
* Experience with telecom vendor portals, data and ordering processes
* Excellent written and verbal communications
* Ability to effectively work with all levels throughout the organization and motivate others
* Possess a professional attitude and work ethic in addition to being well organized and efficient
* Ability to deal with unforeseen situations and come up with logical solutions to these problems without outside instruction


**Benefits:**  

Point Broadband offers a competitive salary, cash bonus, and equity in a stable and fast-growing business.
  
  

* Medical (3 plans to choose from), Dental and Vision
* Short Term Disability
* Flexible Spending Accounts
* Company Paid Life as well as Voluntary policies
* 401(k) with generous company match
* Paid Time Off
* Share the Care Paid Time Off
* Paid Holidays
* Uniform/Boot allowance \\*Applicable by Position\\*
* Cell Phone Allowance \\*Applicable by Position\\*
* Career Progression Opportunities
* Discounted Broadband Services \\*Where Applicable\\*


Point Broadband is an equal opportunity employer. For further information, please visit:

description:

title: Cyber Security Engineer
description:
ASSYST is seeking a talented and motivated individual to join our team as a Cybersecurity Engineer. In this role, you will play a critical part in maintaining and enhancing the backend and frontend of Cybersecurity program tools, ensuring the security and integrity of the systems and data. As a valued member of our Security Engineering team, you will have the opportunity to work with industry-leading tools such as ForeScout, Tenable, Splunk, and more, while driving progress on key projects and operational tasks. If you are passionate about cybersecurity and possess a strong technical skill set, we invite you to apply and be a part of our dynamic team at ASSYST.


**Key Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with risk management and cybersecurity teams to understand network security requirements.
* Design, implement, and manage network security controls, devices, and solutions.
* Conduct regular assessments to identify network vulnerabilities and potential risks.
* Implement and maintain firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, and other security tools.
* Monitor network traffic for signs of unauthorized access or malicious activities.
* Assist in the development of incident response plans and playbooks.
* Collaborate with IT teams to ensure network security compliance with industry standards.
* Provide network security expertise and guidance to cross-functional teams.
* Stay current with emerging threats, vulnerabilities, and security technologies.
* Prepare and present network security reports to stakeholders and management.


**Requirements:**


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or related field; or equivalent work experience.
* Demonstrated experience in maintaining and administering security tools such as ForeScout, Tenable, Splunk, and Invicti / NetSparker in an enterprise environment.
* Proficiency in managing AWS servers and VMware virtual machine environments.
* Strong understanding of network troubleshooting principles and methodologies.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to effectively convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Experience with vulnerability assessment and reporting methodologies.
* Familiarity with ticketing systems such as JIRA and ServiceNow for task and project management.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and independently on assigned tasks.
* Ability to obtain and maintain any required security clearances or certifications as needed by the organization.


**ASSYST Benefits:**


*We are proud to offer a robust benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401(k) retirement plan, disability insurance, flexible spending accounts and more in order for our employees to maintain a secure work/life balance.*


***ASSYST*** *is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, military status, national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or applicable local law*

title: Cloud Optical Network Engineer
description:
Are you captivated by the transformative potential of advanced optical networking technologies within the realm of Artificial Intelligence? Do you see yourself laying down the high-speed optical pipelines that connect a global array of Graphics Processing Units (GPUs) and Central Processing Units (CPUs)? Are you compelled by the opportunity to drive forward self-healing, adaptive networks that will bring AI systems to new heights of intelligent operation and efficiency? If these challenges strike a chord, then you might be the perfect fit for our team.  

  

In your capacity as a Cloud Optical Network Engineer for AI Systems, you will be at the forefront of operating and deploying optical networking solutions, meticulously fine-tuned for the rigorous demands of AI-centric applications. You won’t just be in a think-tank but will engage in hands-on, hard-core engineering work to transform innovative ideas into functional, scalable network solutions. This role is both a developmental and operational endeavor, placing you at the confluence of technological research and global network strategy. Engage in research-focused activities that translate into operational excellence, leading to the creation of state-of-the-art automation platforms. This position is your pathway to rapid career growth in this burgeoning field of technology. Alongside a deep dive into the intricacies of AI-optimized optical networking, you'll master the crucial skills indispensable for automation on a large-scale network. Moreover, the role offers a flexible work arrangement, balancing remote work with essential in-lab activities, giving you the best of both worlds. If you're prepared to get your hands dirty while shaping the future landscape of AI through unparalleled optical networking, we warmly invite you to step into this critical role.  

  

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Develops knowledge of optical network technologies to draw insights that aid in network design, standards, implementation, and operation.
* Develops an understanding of quality assurance and network or code review processes by assisting in identifying risks and classes of bugs and becoming familiar with essential details related to network implementation (e.g., physical connectivity, power, protocols, telemetry) and design qualification with guidance from other engineers.
* Contributes to the development or modification of network automation tools with guidance from other engineers to make efficient use of infrastructure and resources by automating performance of various tasks related to network operations, testing, and incident management.
* Works within a team of engineers to manage network deployments; works with a machine-readable definition of the network deployment and build automation to support the rapid deployment of long-haul optical networks.
* Monitors optical network telemetry and performs basic analyses to triangulate failures, with guidance from other engineers; makes suggestions on possible monitoring improvements; participate in all efforts to automate repetitive tasks to reduce implementation time and avoid failures due to human error.
* Triages, troubleshoots, and repairs live site issues using troubleshooting guides and standard tooling with minimal disruption to customers; participates in on-call/Designated Responsible Individual (DRI) duties, postmortems, and root cause analysis processes.
* Identifies gaps in our operational and deployment strategies and solves problems with technical acumen and automated approach.

**Qualifications**
------------------


Required/Minimum Qualifications:* 5+ years technical experience in network design, development, and automation
	+ OR Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Optical Engineering, Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or related field AND 2+ years technical experience in network design, development, and automation.
	+ OR Master's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Optical Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND 1+ year(s) technical experience in network design, development, and automation.
* 3+ years of Optical Communications and Dense Wavelength Division Multiplexing (DWDM) experience.


Other Requirements:* Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


Additional or Preferred Qualifications:* 8+ years technical experience in network design, development, and automation
+ OR Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Optical Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND 5+ years technical experience in network design, development, and automation
+ OR Master's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Optical Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND 3+ years technical experience in network design, development, and automation
+ OR Doctorate Degree in Electrical Engineering, Optical Engineering, Computer Science, InformationTechnology, or related field.

  

Cloud Network Engineering IC3 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $94,300 - $182,600 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $120,900 - $198,600 per year.
Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits and pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay
