title: Network Engineer I
description:
DYOPATH, a leading Managed Service Provider (MSP), was founded to empower organizations by delivering trusted IT solutions. At DYOPATH, we pursue both purpose and success, knowing one will ultimately lead to the other. Our core values foster a culture that promotes accountability, excellence, exceptional customer service, and sustainability. Our team is passionate, fun, creative, and courageous in communications.

 **TITLE:** Network Engineer I
**LOCATION:** REMOTE
**SHIFT:** Monday - Friday from 8AM to 5PM (subject to change)
**STATUS:** W2 Full-Time with Benefits
**SALARY:** 75K - 95K depending on experience  



* Experience with Cisco Routers/Switches/Wireless


* Experience with Fortigate Routers/Switches/Wireless


* Experience configuring/maintaining VPN Solutions


* Experience with RMM tools (Auvik/N-Able preferred)


* Experience with AZURE/MS365


* Nice to have: Experience with Ubiquiti equipment



**Job Summary**



Performs intermediate and frequently non-routine network administration including account creation and maintenance, system monitoring, security tracking, and user support. May include support using remote access applications.


**Essential Functions and Responsibilities**



The following duties are primarily performed and are essential for this position. Employees are expected to be able to perform each of these job duties satisfactorily and successfully to be qualified for the position. Other duties may be required and assigned.


* Leading and participating in the installation, monitoring, maintenance, support, and optimization of all network hardware, software, communication links, and routing protocols
* Planning, assisting in designing, and developing local area networks (LANs), wide area networks (WANs), virtual private networks (VPNs), and network security (firewalls, IDS, NAC)
* Monitoring, analyzing and resolving network hardware and software problems in a timely and accurate fashion
* Connect, operate, and monitor network systems
* Close cooperation with the data center, operations and technical teams
* Create and maintain network documentation of logical network level, physical network design, VLANs, Firewalls, Routing-Protocol
* Work with the existing team to improve telecommunications and network options for remote communications
* Create and optimize internal network and infrastructure processes
* Analyze, diagnose and troubleshoot issues in network environment
* Responds and assists Level I Engineer with complex connectivity problems.
* Communicates effectively with management, team leader, and team members.
* Develops and maintains a high level of customer satisfaction and improved customer relations.
* May oversee or assist Level I Engineer in installation of communications hardware; may oversee minor equipment repairs.
* Other Duties as assigned


 **Education Qualifications**



 Minimum Required Education and/or Experience Requirements:


* Bachelor's Degree.


* Five years of experience in networking field


**Preferred Education and/or Experience Requirements**


* Bachelor's degree in IT preferred


**Licenses, Certifications, and Other Requirements**



 CCNA


**Preferred Licenses, Certifications, and Other Requirements:**



Prefer ASTEA familiarity; A+ and OEM equipment certifications preferred, Fortinet, and Meraki certs advisable.


**Minimum Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Qualifications**



In order to perform the functions and responsibilities of the position (listed above) the following knowledge, skills, and abilities are essential.


* Takes a leadership role in Service/Quality Initiative; continually improves processes; quantitatively monitors processes.
* Completes required quality core classes and uses skills and techniques presented. Uses The Core Values in work environment.
* Adheres to company/customer safety procedures.
* Must be a team player, organized, self-motivated, and able to prioritize; must have outstanding people and communication skills for interaction with other team members, customers, and management
* Ability to: read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations; write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals.
* Effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public; add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measurement, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals; compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs; solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists; interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.

  


**Travel Requirements**


* Ability to travel 25% of the time.


* Must be able to work outside of normal work hours occasionally.


**Work Environment**



Work is performed in standard office/remote setting or on customer site.



**Benefits**
* Medical, Dental, Prescription, Vision, Life and Disability Insurance
* Flexible Spending Account (FSA) as well as Health Savings Account (HSA) – *save money pre-tax for eligible medical expenses*
* Employee Assistance Program and Comprehensive Wellness Program
* 401 (k) Retirement Savings Plan with company match
* PTO - Paid Holidays and Vacation Time – *encouraging work-life balance*
* Continuous Learning and Development Programs
* Employee Referral Programs
* Pet Insurance plans
* Bonus Incentive Programs
* Growth opportunities


**Equal Opportunity Employer**



DYOPATH is committed to a work environment free of all forms of discrimination. DYOPATH recruits and hires without regard to age, color, disability, gender, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, military status, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. For more information about DYOPATH, please visit our website at www.dyopath.com.The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this classification. It is not designed to contain or to be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of the employee assigned to this job.

title: Network Engineer
description:
**Become an Outcoder as a Network Engineer**


We seek a Network Engineer to design, implement, maintain, and support our growing network infrastructure. You will be part of a systems engineering team responsible for designing and developing scalable, maintainable, highly available network architectures that meet business objectives and SLAs.


**What you'll need to be successful:**


* Proven hands-on network engineering experience
* CCNP or higher (CCIE and CISSP highly valued)
* Deep understanding of networking protocols (e.g., IPSEC, HSRP, BGP, OSPF, 802.11, quality of service)
* Solid understanding of the OSI or TCP/IP model
* Hands-on experience with monitoring, network diagnostic, and network analytics tools
* University degree in Computer Science or a related subject


**About us:** EX² Outcoding is a premier solution provider of a broad range of outsourcing services, combining proven expertise in technology and project execution for companies searching for high-quality software development solutions. We specialize in delivering the best technical solution but also in enhancing that solution creatively by working closely with stakeholders to understand the business context.


#LI-REMOTE

title: Network Engineer
description:
**Who we are:**



At Glydways, we believe that mobility is a basic human right. Low-cost and ubiquitous access to affordable housing, employment, education, commerce and care lead to economic and social prosperity. As such our goal is to provide:



Public transit with the highest capacity, the best user experience, the lowest cost, and the lowest carbon footprint.



Our solution is a system of interconnected, profitable, and carbon footprint neutral transportation networks that uses standardized autonomous vehicles and a closed roadway. Together, they provide a 24/7 on-demand private mobility service without burdening the public with heavy upfront costs or annual system subsidies.

**Meet the team:**



At the core of our solution is the problem of coordinating a massive number of riders and vehicles in a system that operates safely and efficiently. To build our transportation solution, we are looking for a Network Engineer to define and oversee the installation, configuration, maintenance and monitoring of our reliable, available, performant and secure network infrastructure.


**Roles & Responsibilities:**


* Design and implement a modern secure high-observable, high-reliability wired/wireless network for a next-generation transit system
* Maintain and optimize network performance by monitoring network availability, throughput, and latency
* Engage in component and source selection for wired/wireless network components
* Design/Implement/Maintain Glydways' on-site test network at our autonomous vehicle testing facility
* Design/Implement/Maintain Glydways' production network deployments


**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**


* Hands-on experience as a Network/Wireless Network Engineer
* Experience implementing, instrumenting, and maintaining high-reliability network infrastructure
* Experience in wireless network infrastructure definition, sourcing and deployment

  

Glydways provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Network Engineer
description:
Description: **Job Description:**


Our team is looking for a network engineer who will be responsible for the following tasks.

* Provisioning of network equipment.
* Network monitoring and alarm clearing.
* Troubleshooting network issues and outages.
* Performing audits on network equipment.
* Testing and QAing new software and tools for the development team.


Full training will be provided but previous experience in a NOC or Network Engineering role would be a big advantage.

**What will you do?**


If we are fortunate enough to have you on our team, we will need you to:

* Work with our provisioning team to configure new routers and switches prior to deployment on our network. Configure existing network equipment for new customers and links.
* Use our monitoring tools to clear alarms and identify and troubleshoot network issues.
* Create tickets to document work carried out and issues which require further attention.
* Work on audit projects to ensure all our networking equipment is accounted for and is being monitored correctly.
* Work closely with our development team to help them test new tools and software and report any issues with existing monitoring tools and software.


Requirements:
**What will help your application with WiLine?**


If you would like to apply to us, the following will help your chances!

* CCNA Certification is an advantage.
* 2+ years of experience in a NOC or Network Engineering role is desirable.
* Previous experience configuring Cisco routers and switches is desirable.
* Previous skills/experience dealing with technical faults with good attention to detail.
* Effective problem-solving skills.
* Well organised, with the ability to work proactively in a team in a busy environment.


We wish you the best of luck with your job search and hope to work with you soon!

title: Network Engineer
description:
Looking for an exciting career in Telecom? We are Bold Business, a US-based leading solutions company in the telecommunications industry. We are always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our team. In order to provide extraordinary solutions to our customers, we need to work with extraordinary people to create and deliver them, people like you.

* Push scripts for the following:
	+ Re-Ip printers
	+ Re-Ip RF Guns

* Troubleshoot all network issues. Need techs familiar with desktop support, Toshiba 4800 POS terminals, signature pads, and pushing scripts.

title: Network Administrator Engineer - Work Remotely
description:
Klos Consulting, Inc. provides IT consulting to businesses throughout Dade, Broward and Palm Beach Counties. We have been in business for over 20 years but we have the energy and enthusiasm of a startup. We are lean, our engineers are smart, and our clients are the best at what they do. In order to be successful here it’s best if you demand the most from yourself in everything you do, and are ready to work hard. You’ll grow with Klos Consulting. We want this to be the last place you ever work, and the sky is the limit!

  

You will be responsible for keeping our client’s networks running like a well-oiled machine. Our service department works together and always has each other’s back. You will interact with clients A LOT! So the ability to stay professional and positive no mater what is going on is imperative! Our clients will love you and you’ll love them. There is no problem we can’t solve. Every day will be different. Some days you’ll work on simple help desk tickets, other days you may work on servers at our state of the art co-location facility. You will need to be super proactive, and independent. It will be up to you to make sure every project you work on, big or small, is done with the utmost precision and the clients are beyond thrilled.

 **Minimum Experience & Education:**


* Three to five years of experience in an IT support environment.
* Bachelor's degree, MCSE, A+ certification desirable.


**Skills:**


* Configure 365 and Azure
* Installation of numerous PC applications (MS Office Suite, QuickBooks, Acrobat, etc.).
* Staging, configuring and deploying servers, desktops, laptops & peripherals, especially Dell hardware.
* Windows 2008 - 2019 Server administration and management.
* Windows 7 - 10 support.
* Technical troubleshooting of a variety of hardware and software issues.
* LAN/WAN and Wi-Fi management and configuration.
* Maintaining operating systems, security, and applications.
* Setting up and managing SMB networks: various hardware/software platforms, backup/recovery strategies, printers/scanners, and other critical office infrastructure.
* Answer and appropriately handle incoming customer support requests via phone, email, and in person. Escalate internally or contact vendors when appropriate.
* Provide new users with IT orientation.
* Document, track and monitor all problem/resolution activity in the tracking system to ensure a timely resolution.

  


**This position is remote/work from home**, with weekly in person team meetings and travel throughout the Tri-County area to client sites. All tools of the job are provided. Qualified individuals must have reliable transportation. We conduct a criminal background check, verify driving record, and random drug testing. This position may be required to lift up to 50 lbs. Early morning, evening, and occasional weekend work are required. Some scheduling flexibility may be afforded for students enrolled in relevant coursework.

 **We provide a** cell phone, laptop, mileage reimbursement, health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, life insurance, retirement, educational growth opportunities, paid holidays, vacation and a competitive salary.

title: Mid-Level Network Engineer
description:
Looking for an opportunity to make an impact? Fusion Technology is building a team to serve as the Mid-Level Network Engineer for the Automated Biometric Identification Systems (ABIS) contract.


 If this sounds like the kind of environment where you can thrive while being challenged, keep reading!

 **Primary Responsibilities:**

* Possess and apply expertise on multiple complex work assignments. Assignments may be broad in nature, requiring originality and innovation in determining how to accomplish tasks. Operate with appreciable latitude in developing methodology and presenting solutions to problems. Contribute to deliverables and performance metrics where applicable.
* Provide technical guidance for directing and monitoring information systems operations. Designs, builds, and implements network systems.
* Directs compilation of records and reports concerning network operations and maintenance. Troubleshoots network performance issues. Analyzes network traffic and provides capacity-planning solutions.
* Monitors and responds to complex technical control facility hardware and software problems. Interfaces with vendor support service groups to ensure proper escalation during outages or periods of degraded system performance.
* Manages the testing, installation, and support of network communications, including LAN/MAN/WAN and cloud-based systems.
* Performs system-level design and configuration of products including determination of hardware, OS, cloud-based and other platform specifications.
* Ensures DOD cyber compliance of all assigned systems / equipment.
* Performs a variety of systems engineering tasks and activities that are broad in nature and are concerned with major systems design, integration, and implementation, including personnel, hardware, software, budgetary, and support facilities and/or equipment to include cloud services.
* Provides quality assurance review and the evaluation of new and existing network related products.
* Provides input to policy level discussions regarding standards and budget constraints.
* Monitors / mentors more junior network engineers on staff.
* Monitors responds to hardware and network problems.
* Provides the routine testing and analysis of all elements of the network facilities (including power, software, communications machinery, lines, modems, and terminals).
* Utilizes software and hardware tools and identifies and diagnoses complex problems and factors affecting network performance.
* Troubleshoots network systems when necessary and makes improvements to the network.

 **Qualifications and Preferred Experience/Skills:**

* Current Active DOD or DOJ **Secret** security clearance, with the ability to obtain a DoD **Top Secret** Security Clearance.
* Prior DoD ABIS, IAFIS, Biometrics or related experience is a definite plus.
* Able to obtain DOD 8570 certifications (Cyber Security and Environment) within 60 days of hire.
* CISCO certifications:
	+ CCNA – Routing and Switching
	+ CCNA – Security
	+ CCNP – Routing and Switching
	+ CCDA – Cisco Certified Design Associate
	+ CCENT – Cisco Certified Entry Networking Technician
* AWS experience

 **What matters to you matters to us.**


Fusion Technology values its employees and works hard to ensure proper care for them and their families. We desire to compensate employees in a competitive, motivational, fair, and equitable way with other employers in the marketplace. Salary is only one component of employee compensation but an integral part of recruiting and retaining qualified employees. However, at Fusion Technology, we take a comprehensive approach and consider each employee's needs to tailor a compensation plan that provides financial security and peace of mind. Our completive package includes a best-in-class matching 401K program, comprehensive Cigna healthcare plan, a competitive employer contribution to a health savings account, vision and dental plans, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, and personal leave, in addition to paid certifications and training.


Fusion Technology LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

title: Network Engineer
description:
India
Information Technology (IT)
Group Functions
**Job Reference #**


284214BR
**City**


Pune
**Job Type**


Full Time
**Your role**


Do you have a knack for technology? Are you at your best when supporting others? We’re looking for someone like that to:  

* support the Juniper/ Cisco network infrastructure in UBS
* uphold high standards for timely issue resolution
* contribute expertise to the management of existing and new IT products and services
* define workarounds for known errors and initiate process improvements
* maintain a knowledge database

**Your team**


You’ll be working with the Networks Operations Team based in Nashville. You will be part of a global outfit that provides follow the sun services to our clients.
**Your expertise**


* minimum of 5 years industry experience with strong knowledge in network technologies and incident management, ideally in the Financial Services industry.
* network professional with CCNP certification or equivalent level of experience working in a 2nd line infrastructure role along with proven analytical, conceptual, problem-solving, and problem management abilities
* demonstrable track record of support and troubleshooting of core network enterprise infrastructure and devices around Cisco (JUNOS, Cisco IOS/Nexus), Juniper (Juniper MX,EX & SRX platforms) and Arista technologies as well as experience in working with MPLS wide area networks.
* strong understanding and troubleshooting skills across all key technologies in Enterprise Data Center and Client LAN Networks (e.g. ACI, VRF, HSRP, VPC, LACP, QoS, Multicast); WAN technologies (e.g. SDWAN, MPLS); Public Cloud providers (Azure, AWS, GCP ); WiFi products and technologies (Cisco, Meraki)
* strong understanding and troubleshooting skills across routing protocols (e.g. EIGRP, OSPF, BGP) and key network protocols (e.g., TCP/IP & UDP, SNMP, FTP, TFTP, SSH, IPSec)
* experience with Cisco products is essential (e.g. Cisco ACI, Cisco DNAC, N9Ks, Cat9Ks); Arista and Juniper Routers & Switches is desirable
* experience with Network/Monitoring tools (e.g. Grafana, Zabbix, Splunk, ThousandEyes) and Network Sniffers (e.g. Wireshark/ TCPDUMP etc.)
* desired experience with Load Balancers (e.g. F5, Citrix), DHCP/DNS applications (e.g. Infoblox), Firewalls (e.g. Palo Alto, Fortinet)


**About us**


UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.  

With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?

This role requires an assessment on application. Learn more about how we hire: www.ubs.com/global/en/careers/experienced-professionals.html
**Join us**


At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.  

From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?

UBS Recruiting India

title: Rf Engineer
description:
Summary:
Primarily provides pre-sales technical support for the development and implementation of complex products/applications/solutions. Uses in-depth product knowledge to provide technical expertise to sales staff and the customer through sales presentations and product demonstrations. Assists the sales staff in assessing potential application of company products to meet customer needs and may prepare detailed product specifications for the development and implementation of customer products/applications/solutions. May create detailed design and implementation specifications for complex products/applications/solutions. May build a mini-application based on customer requirements to demonstrate feasibility of the application, often requiring rapid prototyping and/or product demo for client. May provide consultation to prospective users and/or product capability assessment and validation.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Solutions engineers in VIAVI are expected to be subject matter experts in specified fields and technologies, working in a sales environment to support VIAVI products and business plans. We are looking for professionals with knowledge and experience in radio frequency (RF) communications (e.g., 4G/5G cellular test, non-cellular communications systems such as land-mobile radio). The responsibilities include:* Listening to understanding concerns and challenges of RF communications customers - including cellular service providers, network equipment manufacturers/integrators, government organizations and enterprises – issues faced with network quality, performance test, maintenance or ramp test, design validation, etc.
* Engage in detailed technical and applications discussions with customers to appropriately position solutions from VIAVI to help customers achieve their results.
* Work closely with sales teams and sales partners to drive product sales for the selected technologies or application areas.
* Contribute to business growth - identify and seed potential new opportunities, lead or be in a cross-functional team to identify growth opportunities and execute on growth plans. Support marketing programs to build awareness and advantages of VIAVI products and solutions.
* Work with product units collaboratively to provide feedback on customer application/feature needs, product gaps and/or improvements to improve VIAVI competitive position in the market, provide market and competitive feedback and work with business units to get what is needed to win.


We are currently looking for a suitable candidate to support our operations in India. The preferred work location is Mumbai or Gurugram, but we can be flexible on office location for the right candidate. Wherever the location, the job will require travel within India and occasionally beyond.
If your experience and knowledge include some of these, then we’re looking for you:* Broad understanding of RF and radio communications technologies, as applied in secure/mission-critical communications or cellular applications.
	+ Land mobile radio or critical communications (“LMR” or “PMR”), such as analog radios, P25, DMR, TETRA.
	+ Understanding 5G/4G cellular – network architecture, typical RF network issues faced by cellular service providers in 4G/5G RAN, with specific knowledge of RF parameters.
* RF testing in design, manufacturing, or field test. Familiarity with common test instruments/systems such as radio communications testers (VIAVI or equivalent), spectrum/signal analyzers, either as a user, in a service provision role or in test solutions provider.
* 5-7 years of experience in the fields and environments described above. We are open to making exceptions for outstanding candidates showing strong willingness to learn, or with a proven track record of performance.
	+ Experience with test systems, test system automation including instrument programming (e.g. Python) will be given additional preference
* Strong communications - ability to listen, present technological and product information, articulate complex ideas. Communicate value propositions. Good written and speaking style.
* Demonstrable track-record of success in a sales environment – target oriented, good management of time and priorities, working with cross functional groups.
* Can work autonomously and work with a team. Self-learner.
* Experience with customer interactions in pre-sales, projects, documenting compliances or putting together value propositions.
* Willing to travel domestically and internationally. Travel in normal times may be up to 40% of work days.


Pre-Requisites / Skills / Experience Requirements:
